oai_dc:dc.dc:title: St. Marks Presbyterian Church: front view 2
oai_dc:dc.dc:creator: West, Carroll Van
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: St. Marks Presbyterian Church, Kyle and Hasson Streets, Rogersville, Hawkins Co., TN

Color photograph of a church; front view; two stories; the lower portion has red brick stairs; upper portion has white panel with pointed arched doorways with white double doors and two sets of large sectioned rectangle stained glass windows; gable roof with white bell cupola on left

St. Marks Presbyterian church was founded c. 1875 by Reverend William H. Franklin, also pastor. It is significantly associated with Swift College, an African American institution in Upper East Tennessee from 1883 to the mid-1960s. The church ministered to the faculty, students, and community of Swift. The church dissolved on July 21, 2002.
oai_dc:dc.dc:subject: African American Churches -- Tennessee; Church buildings -- Tennessee
